document.masterDocTitle: Review of the genus Scythropiodes Matsumura, 1931 (Lepidoptera, Lecithoceridae, Oditinae) from China, with a checklist of the world

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Review of the genus Scythropiodes Matsumura, 1931 (Lepidoptera, Lecithoceridae, Oditinae) from China, with a checklist of the world

heading.emphasis:
Key to the species of
Scythropiodes
in
China

paragraph.keyLead: 1 Forewing ground color yellowish brown or brown.......................................................... 2
- Forewing ground color pale yellow or white or greyish white................................................ 10
- Forewing with neither discal nor discocellular spot.......................................................... 9

3 Valvae asymmetrical; juxta with two short lobes posteriorly (
Fig. 32
)........................
S. asymmetricus
sp. nov.

5 Valva with a thumbed process in dorsal surface (
Fig. 26
).................................
S. dorsoprocessus
sp. nov.
- Valva without thumbed process in dorsal surface........................................................... 6

6 Transtilla with a pair of thin digitate lateral lobes (
Clarke 1955 : Pl. 235 ,
Fig. 3
b
)...........................
S. lividula
- Transtilla with a pair of oval or subtriangular lateral lobes.................................................... 7

7 Transtilla with oval lateral lobes; phallus with a hook-shaped process distally (
Fig. 28
)......................
S. oncinius
- Transtilla with subtriangular lateral lobes; phallus without process distally....................................... 8

8 Valva with a digitate apical process (
Fig. 29
)......................................................
S. malivora

- Valva with a thorn-shaped apical process (
Fig. 27
).................................................
S. elasmatus

9 Valva bifurcated from distal 1 / 4 , juxta inverted triangular; transtilla without lateral lobe (
Fig. 25
)..............
S. gnophus

- Valva not bifurcated distally, juxta trapezoidal; transtilla with lateral lobes (
Fig. 24
)......................
S. barbellatus

10 Forewing ground color pale yellow; juxta with paired horn-shaped lateral lobes and a median forked process posteriorly (
Figs 16
, 31 )....................................................................................
S. triangulus

11 Forewing without spots in cell; valva with two digitate processes and an oval process distally (
Moriuti 1977 :
Figs 7
, 15
)................................................................................................
S. venusta

12 Phallus without cornutus; valva subquadrate (
Fig. 21
)..............................................
S. hamatellus

14 Phallus with two cornuti, transtilla with subrectangular lateral lobes bearing two spines (
Fig. 22
).............
S. jiulianae

- Phallus with four to five cornuti, transtilla with semioval lateral lobes bearing no spines (
Fig. 30
)................
S. issikii

16 Valva gradually narrowed from distal 1 / 3 , with a short apical spine (
Fig. 20
)..............................
S. tribula

- Valva suddenly produced from distal 1 / 3 to a finger-like apical process (
Fig. 19
)......................
S. approximans

18 Valva with a spine-like apical process (
Fig. 23
)...........................................
S. aculeiformus
sp. nov.

- Valva with a digitate apical process (
Clarke 1955 : Pl. 240 ,
Fig. 3
b
)....................................
S. velipotens
